intro: Reholttumia inclusa, commonly known as the slender sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets. Native to the wetlands and moist soils of eastern North America, it thrives in environments with consistent moisture. The plant typically grows to a height of 10 to 30 centimeters and is often found in marshes, swamps, and along the edges of ponds. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems, supporting various insect and bird species.
